result.execSummary:
The defendant Roscoe D McClendon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will waive costs and surcharges due to defendant serving more time than the maximum sentence.

With credit for 45 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: any sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roscoe D McClendon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
3/18/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Roscoe D McClendon in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

Court sentences defendant to serve 45 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 45 days, concurrent, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court will waive costs and surcharges due to defendant serving more time than the maximum sentance.

20 day appeal right given.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed.

Defendant Roscoe D McClendon in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. For reasons stated on the record, court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roscoe D McClendon in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is awaiting discovery from prior attorney, received offer from state at todays proceedings.   

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 31  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roscoe D McClendon in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney J. Dennis Thornton informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
